intro: Haplocoelum gallaense, commonly known as the Gallaese sponge or Gallaese liverwort, is a type of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a distinct gametophyte stage and lacks true roots, stems, and leaves. It reproduces through the production of spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. Haplocoelum gallaense is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
